author: wsjcom
title: Let the Noble but Aged A-10 Enjoy a Well-Deserved Rest
text:
I would like to address Phil Mooney’s Jan. 30 letter suggesting that the Air Force pull A-10s out of boneyards. This may sound like a great idea, but it isn’t cost effective or in most cases even possible.
I have worked in aerospace for 38 years and on eight different military airplanes. Companies assign each airplane a lifetime number of hours the planes can fly safely. The amount of stress each warfighter’s internal metal structures experience within each flight is astonishing. Each flight can cause very small amounts of...
